word:
Those who have assigned to the charitable uses of the Institute the interest, or dividend, of their stock, have done a noble thing, which will meet its reward. All those who have not made an assignment, who are able to do so, should, at their first opportunity, assign all, or a part, as most of the stockholders have done. And as the 
                                                                           29
growing interest and usefulness of this institution demands it, all, especially those who have not, should continue to take stock in it.
